description: Ruleset for assay type is CAGE-seq.
title: FAANG experiments metadata rules for CAGE-seq
name: faang_experiments_cage-seq.metadata_rules

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

experiment_target.name: experiment target
experiment_target.description: What the experiment was trying to find, list the text rather than ontology link, please use 'TSS'.

cage_protocol.name: cage protocol
cage_protocol.description: Link to the protocol used for CAGE-seq treatments.

sequencing_primer_provider.name: sequencing primer provider
sequencing_primer_provider.description: The name of the company, laboratory or person that provided the sequencing primer library.

sequencing_primer_catalog.name: sequencing primer catalog
sequencing_primer_catalog.description: The catalog from which the sequencing primer library was purchased.

sequencing_primer_lot.name: sequencing primer lot
sequencing_primer_lot.description: The lot identifier of the sequencing primer library.

restriction_enzyme_target_sequence.name: restriction enzyme target sequence
restriction_enzyme_target_sequence.description: The DNA sequence targeted by the restriction enzyme.

rna_purity_260-280_ratio.name: rna purity - 260:280 ratio
rna_purity_260-280_ratio.description: Sample purity assessed with fluorescence ratio at 260 and 280nm, informative for protein contamination.

rna_purity_260-230_ratio.name: rna purity - 260:230 ratio
rna_purity_260-230_ratio.description: Sample purity assessed with fluorescence ratio at 260 and 230nm, informative for contamination by phenolate ion, thiocyanates, and other organic compounds.

rna_integrity_number.name: rna integrity number
rna_integrity_number.description: It is important to obtain this value, but if you are unable to supply this number (e.g. due to machine failure) then by submitting you are asserting the quality by visual inspection of traces and agreeing that the samples were suitable for sequencing. For more information on RNA Integrity Numbers see Schroeder et al. (2006) http://bmcmolbiol.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/1471-2199-7-3.
